info.title: Fortify on Demand Web API Explorer

get.summary: Retrieves an individual application by id
Retrieve a collection of applications

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
A delimited list of field filters.

Field name and value should be separated by a colon (:).

Multiple fields should be separated by a plus (+). Example, fieldname1:value+fieldname2:value

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The field name to order the results by.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the starting record. 0 indicates the first record.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum records to return. The maximum value allowed is 50.

post.summary: Create a new application and release

get.summary: Returns the associated auto-run report type for the application.

post.summary: Set-up the associated auto-run report for the application

get.summary: Returns a list of users that have access to the application
Returns the permissions the current user has for the application

parameters.name: releaseId
parameters.description: Release Id of the scan to start

get.summary: Returns a list of lookup items for the given type

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of lookup items to return

post.summary: Starts a mobile scan for the given release

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date for the scan in MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm format

parameters.name: assessmentTypeId
parameters.description: The assessment type id for the scan

parameters.name: frameworkType
parameters.description: The framework type id. Only iOS and Android are supported at this time

parameters.name: fragNo
parameters.description: -1 indicates the fragment of bytes has been sent. The value starts with 0 and increments by 1 for each fragment of bytes sent

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the bytes sent. 0 indicates the first bytes

parameters.name: isRemediationScan
parameters.description: Indicates of the scan is a remediation scan

parameters.name: requestModel
parameters.description: the username, password, and authorization method

get.summary: Returns all of the data for the vulnerability
Returns the vulnerability summary
Returns the vulnerability details
Returns the vulnerability recommendations
Returns the vulnerability history
Returns the vulnerability screenshots
Returns a screenshot
Returns the vulnerability request and response
Returns the vulnerability headers
Returns the vulnerability parameters
Returns the vulnerability traces
Returns the trace code for the specific index
Returns the vulnerability audit options

post.summary: Saves audit data for the vulnerabilities

get.summary: Get available vulnerability filters

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
A delimited list of field filters.

Field name and value should be separated by a colon (:).

Multiple fields should be separated by a plus (+). Example, fieldname1:value+fieldname2:value

applicationDescription.description: Description of the application that will help you manage multiple applications

applicationCreatedDate.description: The date the application was created

emailList.description: List the email addresses of additional people who should be informed of activity related to this release

applicationDescription.description: Description of the application that will help you manage multiple applications

emailList.description: List the email addresses of additional people who should be informed of activity related to this release. Separate multiple email addresses with a semicolon or comma

attributes.description: Application attributes. This is an array of key/value objects. Example, [{"Attribute 1": "value 1"}, {"Attribute 2": "value 2"}, {"Attribute 3": "value 3"} ]

success.description: Indicates if the application was updated
Indicates if the application was deleted

applicationDescription.description: Description of the application that will help you manage multiple applications

applicationType.description: Indicates if the application is a mobile application

releaseDescription.description: Description to add additional details that help describe the release

emailList.description: List the email addresses of additional people who should be informed of activity related to this release. Separate multiple email addresses with a semicolon or comma

ownerId.description: Select an Owner from the list of registered users in your tenant. The "Owner" receives all email notifications related to this application

attributes.description: Application attributes. This is an array of key/value objects. Example, [{"Attribute 1": "value 1"}, {"Attribute 2": "value 2"}, {"Attribute 3": "value 3"} ]

applicationId.description: The id of the application that was created

success.description: Indicates if the application was created

staticScanReportId.description: The report id for static scans

staticScanReportName.description: The report name for static scans

dynamicScanReportId.description: The report id for dynamic scans

dynamicScanReportName.description: The report name for dynamic scans

staticScanReportId.description: The report id used for Static Scans

dynamicScanReportId.description: The report id used for Dynamic Scans

emailNotificationList.description: List of emails separated by semicolon

success.description: Indicates if the auto report was created

users.description: A list of users that have access to the application

startDynamicScan.description: Indicates if the user can start a dynamic scan

startMobileScan.description: Indicates if the user can start a mobile scan

startStaticScan.description: Indicates if the user can start a static scan

createRelease.description: Indicates if the user can create a release

auditIssues.description: Indicates if the user can audit issues

challengeIssues.description: Indicates if the user can challenge issues

editIssues.description: Indicates if the user can edit issues

downloadFPR.description: Indicates if the user can download the FPR

releaseCreatedDate.description: The date the release was created

staticAnalysisStatusType.description: Current status of the static scan on this release (null if no static scan)

dynamicAnalysisStatusType.description: Current status of the dynamic scan on this release (null if no dynamic scan)

mobileAnalysisStatusType.description: Current status of the mobile scan on this release (null if no mobile scan)

staticAnalysisStatusTypeId.description: Current status of the static scan as a numberic identifier

dynamicAnalysisStatusTypeId.description: Current status of the dynamic scan as a numberic identifier

mobileAnalysisStatusTypeId.description: Current status of the mobile scan as a numberic identifier

passFailReasonTypeId.description: Reason for the scan pass/fail id

isFalsePositiveChallenge.description: Indicates if the scan is a false positive challenge

isRemediationScan.description: Indicates if the scan is a remediation scan

isRequired.description: Indicates if the attribute is required

isRestricted.description: Indicates if the attribute is editable only by Security Leads

picklistValues.description: A list of attribute item values

id.description: The id of the attribute item value

name.description: The name of the attribute item value

startDate.description: Date when the scan should start, in MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm format

assessmentTypeId.description: The assessment type id to use for the scan

entitlementId.description: The entitlement id to consume for the scan

entitlementFrequencyType.description: The entitlement frequency type to use for the scan

isRemediationScan.description: Indicates if the scan is a remediation scan. If not supplied the default value is false

scanId.description: The id of the scan that was started

userAccountsRequried.description: Indicates if user accounts are required

hasMultiFactorAuthentication.description: Indicates if multi-factor authentication is used

intrusionDetectionSystem.description: Indicates if intrusion detection system is used

intrusionPreventionSystem.description: Indicates if intrusion prevention system is used

webApplicationFirewall.description: Indicates if web application firewall is used

proxyServers.description: Indicates if proxy servers are used

loadBalancer.description: Indicates if load balancer is used

preAssessmentCall.description: Indicates if the customer should be contacted prior to beginning the assessment

success.description: Indicates if the mobile scan was updated

scanId.description: The id of the scan that was created

PostMultiFactorAuthorizationCodeRequest.description: Post Multi Factor Authorization Code Request

ownerId.description: The owner id for the release

success.description: Indicates if the release was updated
Indicates if the release was deleted

copyState.description: Indicates if copy state is used

copyStateReleaseId.description: The release id to use if CopyState is true

releaseId.description: The id of the release that was created

success.description: Indicates if the application was created

auditProcessing.description: Indicates if an audit is current processing

canAudit.description: Indicates if the user can audit

canChallenge.description: Indicates if the user can challenge

canEdit.description: Indicates if the user can edit

inAuditMode.description: Indicates if the release is in audit mode

entitlementId.description: The entitlement id. -1 indicates the assessment type is available for purchase

units.description: The number of units the scan will consume

subscriptionEndDate.description: The subscription end date for the entitlement

isRemediation.description: Indicates if a remediation scan is available for the assessment type

remediationScansAvailable.description: The number of remediation scans available for the release and assessment type

success.description: Indicates if the report was deleted

reportId.description: The id of the report that was created

success.description: Indicates if the application was created

scanId.description: The id of the scan that was created

startDate.description: The start date of the entitlement

endDate.description: The end date of the entitlement

oneStarRatingCount.description: The number of one star applications

twoStarRatingCount.description: The number of two star applications

threeStarRatingCount.description: The number of three star applications

fourStarRatingCount.description: The number of four star applications

fiveStarRatingCount.description: The number of five star applications

isVerified.description: Indicates if the user has been verified

isSuspended.description: Indicates if the user's account is suspended

mustChange.description: Indicates if the user must change the password on the next login

passwordNeverExpires.description: Indicates if the password never expires

success.description: Indicates if the user was updated

passwordNeverExpires.description: Indicates if the password never expires

isSuspended.description: Indicates if the user's account is suspended

count.description: Count of items in the filter

isStatic.description: Indicates if the vulnerability is static

user.description: The user that created the history item

canAudit.description: Indicates if the current user can audit the vulnerability

canChallenge.description: Indicates if the current user can challenge the vulnerability

canEdit.description: Indicates if the current user can edit the vulnerability

auditProcessing.description: Indicates if the audit is processing for the release

vulnerabilityIds.description: The list of vulnerability ids to edit
